message.author: 0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89
message.text: bugmail: [Bug 6978] New: Mark eof-terminated script elements as malformed <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009May/0049.html>

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Henri, can I ask you a Firefox build question (Windows)?

message.author: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: sure, but I probably don't know the answer

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: It appears the build runs through, it creates a firefox.exe in dist/bin

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: when I start it, I get my standard install of FF (3.0.10) instead...

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Same if I make a package, unzip it, and start from there...

message.author: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: do you already have the usual Firefox open?

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Likely

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: So do I need to close all instances?

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: ...other...

message.author: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: at least with the Linux version, you need to

message.author: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9
message.text: (unless you run a different profile, which may be advisable anyway)

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Good point.

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Will be gone for a moment due to Chatzilla.

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Henri, that was the problem.

message.author: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9
message.text: ok. good that I can guess some windows things from linux behavior

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: ah yeah, Firefox is annoying with that

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28, I was merely citing it because your message made it seem as if you thought there was WG agreement

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: And I thought there was some treshold criteria for the tracker, but maybe things changed

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: We don't need WG agreement to add something to the tracker.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: That's not what I'm saying

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: In particular, if the author has an outstanding action (ACTION-123) to reply, due 8 days ago.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: Ian?

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Yes.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: Since when can non-telcon participants be assigned action items?

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: What does this have to do with the telco?

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/actions/123

message.author: 0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89
message.text: Title: ACTION-123 - HTML Weekly Tracker (at www.w3.org)

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: Let me state it differently, did he agree to taking that action item?

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: It's against W3C protocol to assign action items to people who did not agree to taking them.

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: I don't know, nor do I think he needs to.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: Based on experience with the W3C I'd say he has to agree

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: But it is ok to add non-chartered stuff to a spec, and then not to reply when asked for th reasons?

message.author: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9
message.text: my 'agreement' to the tracker item assigned to me was that I thought it was against protocol to refuse when Zakim picked me as "victim"

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: Ignoring process for a moment (it wasn't me who added the action...)... But if the WG asks the editor why he did something, I think it deserves an answer.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: You raised the issue two weeks ago. Things take a bit of time

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: If Ian has the time to add these four chapters (vcard, icalendar, bibtext, atom), he probably also has time to explain why.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: If you catch him on IRC you can probably ask if he can prioritize it somewhat if a timely response is important to you

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: I think the fact that there's an overdue action on him should be sufficient information that the WG wants feedback.

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: Seems to me that it followed from the microdata use cases / requirements discussion

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28, I doubt he even knows an action item is assigned to him

message.author: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28
message.text: so he's both not attending telcos *and* not reading the minutes?

message.author: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: FWIW I think the answer to the question is "because it allows the use cases of rich drag and drop / clipboard items" to be fulfilled

message.author: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea
message.text: Although obviously that is not an offical answer

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28, that seems like quite a leap from not knowing he has an action item

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: (In my experience Ian always does action items on time.)

message.author: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea
message.text: 60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28: And whilst I think it makes sense to consider taking the specific mocrodata bits out of HTML 5, keeping the D&D stuff would make the specs codependant on each other. So I'm not sure you'd gain much

message.author: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea
message.text: *microdata

message.author: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea
message.text: (amongst other errors)

message.author: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
message.text: gives up on finding rules on action items
